}} An 'aminoacyl tRNA synthetase' ('aaRS') is an enzyme that catalyzes the
esterification of a specific amino acid or its precursor to one of all its
compatible cognate tRNAs to form an aminoacyl-tRNA. In other words, aminoacyl
tRNA synthetase simply attaches the accurate amino acid onto the corresponding
tRNA. This is sometimes called "charging" or "loading" the tRNA with the amino
acid. Once the tRNA is charged, a ribosome can transfer the amino acid from the
tRNA onto a growing peptide, according to the genetic code.
headings: Expanding the genetic code via mutant aminoacyl tRNA synthetases
